You are here:

SALESFORCE HELP
DOCS
VISUALFORCE B2B COMMERCE
Show the Search Box Widget

Support buyers who prefer to search by keyword when discovering products. When you enable the Search Box widget, a buyer can search by text on a product record, the product's spec values, or custom product tabs. Products that match the search string display on the Product List page.

REQUIRED EDITIONS AND USER PERMISSIONS

Salesforce Compatibility

Salesforce Classic (not available in all orgs) and Lightning Experience for Enterprise, Performance, Unlimited, and Developer editions.




B2B Commerce Compatibility

B2B Commerce for Visualforce Winter ’21 (version 4.13)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’20 (version 4.12)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’19 (version 4.11)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Spring ’19 (version 4.10)
B2B Commerce for Visualforce Summer ’18 (version 4.9)
USER EXPERIENCE COMPATIBILITY
Interface	Bootstrap 3 or classic
Pages	Home page, Product List page, Product Detail page, Product Compare page, Shopping Cart page, My Account page
Page layouts	Side column only of any two- or three-column layout
User visibility	Logged-in users and guest users (depending on your storefront's guest user access)


USER PERMISSIONS NEEDED
To access CC Admin and change settings:	Access B2B Commerce for Visualforce Admin Settings permission set

You can include the Search Box widget in the following locations on a page:

In the header on every page (1).
As a separate widget in the side column of the page body (2). For pages that use the three-column layout, you can specify whether the widget appears in the left or right column.

You can also configure whether the Search Box widget provides autocomplete suggestions for a buyer's search string.

To manage the user experience for the Search Box widget, update your storefront configuration settings:

Specify whether the Search Box widget appears in the header.
On the CC Admin tab in your org, select your storefront (1).
In the Storefront Settings menu, select Configuration Settings (2).
From the Module picklist, select Header (3).
Find the Display Search configuration (4), and make sure that its value is TRUE (5).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Header
Configuration	Display Search
Page	all
Value	TRUE
If you're showing the Search Box widget in the header, enable autocomplete specifically for the widget in the header.
From the Module picklist, select Search/Filter Widget (6).
Find the Product Search Auto configuration (7), and make sure that its value is TRUE (8).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Search/Filter Widget
Configuration	Product Search Auto
Page	all
Value	TRUE
Configure the user experience for the Search Box widget in a page column in the page body.
From the Module picklist, select Search Box (9).
To show the Search Box widget in a page column in the page body, find the Enabled configuration (10). Make sure that its value is TRUE (11).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Search Box
Configuration	Enabled
Page	
all to show the widget on all supported pages
HP to show the widget only on the Home page
PLP to show the widget only on the Product List page
PDP to show the widget only on the Product Detail page
PCP to show the widget only on the Product Compare page
CA to show the widget only on the Shopping Cart page
MA to show the widget only on the My Account page

For the page that you specify, make sure that you also configure the page to use a two- or three-column layout.


Value	TRUE
TIP To show the Search Box widget on multiple supported pages, but not all of them, create multiple configurations. For example, maybe you want to show the Search Box widget on every supported page except the My Account page. Create one setting where Page is all and Value is TRUE, and create a second setting where Page is MA and Value is FALSE.
To enable autocomplete for the Search Box widget in a page column, find the Auto Complete configuration (12), and make sure that its value is TRUE (13).
TIP
If the value is FALSE, click Override in the Action column. Enter TRUE for Value, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Search Box
Configuration	Auto Complete
Page	all
Value	TRUE
If the Search Box widget appears on any pages with a three-column layout, specify whether the widget appears in the left or right column. Find the Location configuration (14), and check its value (15).
TIP
To change the current value, click Override in the Action column. Enter one of the following supported values, and click Create.
If the configuration doesn't exist, click New , enter the following values in the New Page Setting window, and click Create.
FIELD	VALUE
Module	Search Box
Configuration	Location
Page	all
Value	RIGHT or LEFT
Build and activate a new configuration cache.

title: Enabling Search Functionality in Salesforce B2B Commerce
